RelatedSentence: EDINBURG , Texas ( AP ) - A South Texas teenager pleaded guilty Monday to nine counts of manslaughter for a 2012 minivan crash that left nine immigrants dead .
Investigators say Junior Benjamin Rodriguez of Mission was 15 when he fled from Border Patrol agents and flipped a van he was driving in Palmview , west of McAllen .

Authorities believe the van was hauling at least 17 immigrants .
Authorities believe the van was hauling at least 17 immigrants .
Rodriguez , who was charged as an adult , faced nine counts of murder .
He could receive two to 20 years in prison on each count , but those years would run at the same time .
Rodriguez said little Monday as he stood before Hidalgo County District Judge Israel Ramon wearing an orange jumpsuit with his hands shackled .
Immigrants who have entered the U.S. illegally are regularly shuttled from the Rio Grande to stash houses where they are held until the next leg of their journey north is arranged .
